body_html:
@dartdog : Sorry you're having trouble getting started. Hopefully we can sort this out and make things better for future newbies.

I'm unable to reproduce the error. I tried both python 2.7 and python 3.5 and got something like:

Predictions: [ 33.93679047  19.3759346   21.71503448  36.20479584  15.1063385  18.72967148]

(You mentioned that you're using Ubuntu 16.05, but I'm guessing you meant 16.04?)
For example, here's an isolated, reproducible environment using docker and no GPU (just because the environment is easier to reproduce):

docker run -it  ubuntu:16.04 bash 
apt-get update
apt-get install -y python3 python3-dev python3-pandas python3-pip wget
pip3 install --ignore-installed --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.11.0rc0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
mkdir /tmp/boston
cd /tmp/boston
# Download the files
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_train.csv
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_test.csv
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_predict.csv
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/r0.11/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/input_fn/boston.py
python3 boston.py

Are you able to try this out? If it works then it would suggest something in your environment. If not, then we'll have more information to debug :)

body:
@dartdog : Sorry you're having trouble getting started. Hopefully we can sort this out and make things better for future newbies.

I'm unable to reproduce the error. I tried both python 2.7 and python 3.5 and got something like:

```
Predictions: [ 33.93679047  19.3759346   21.71503448  36.20479584  15.1063385  18.72967148]
```

(You mentioned that you're using Ubuntu 16.05, but I'm guessing you meant 16.04?)
For example, here's an isolated, reproducible environment using docker and no GPU (just because the environment is easier to reproduce):

```
docker run -it  ubuntu:16.04 bash 
apt-get update
apt-get install -y python3 python3-dev python3-pandas python3-pip wget
pip3 install --ignore-installed --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.11.0rc0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
mkdir /tmp/boston
cd /tmp/boston
# Download the files
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_train.csv
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_test.csv
wget http://download.tensorflow.org/data/boston_predict.csv
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/r0.11/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/input_fn/boston.py
python3 boston.py
```

Are you able to try this out? If it works then it would suggest something in your environment. If not, then we'll have more information to debug :)
